ohmigosh!!! I just got one of the best calls of my life and I'm about to cry! One of my best friends, C, is PREGNANT!!! Please keep her in your thoughts and prayers that she will have no problems...see, C has been trying to get pregnant for as long as I have known her, three years. Seriously, this girl has done everything, chlomid, ovarian drilling. She was trying a new round of chlomid mixed with met (I had told her I read there was higher success with the two) and then, if that didn't work, she was going to try invitro. The real kicker was the dr's could not find out what was wrong...so she didn't have a face to what she was fighting against. Anyway...she said she started cramping and her hubby said she should take a hpt. Well, she did (Sunday morning) and she said it was positive...she started balling. Of course, she didn't believe it because she had a shot of hcg (?) and figured it was that. So, she didn't tell her hubby and scheduled a blood test with her fertility dr. The blood test came back positive! The dr told her it wouldn't be the hormone shot because that was out of her system a few weeks ago. So, she went and bought "What to expect when you're expecting" and gave it to her hubby...he, of course, was ecstatic. She is still stressed out. I think when you go through what she has to get pregnant, you know worst case scenarios for everything and expect them since, up to this point, you have experienced all worst cases. I tried to calm her and tell her it is okay she isn't feeling sick yet, she is figuring she is six weeks. I know I didn't find out I was pregnant until 8weeks and that was because I woke up with sore breasts...it wasn't until after that the morning sickness hit. I think it comforted her a bit...I was more concerned when she said she was cramping but didn't say anything. We talked about what the book said, it says the cramping is caused by the uterus enlargening and her nurse confirmed that. Whew... She doesn't want anyone to know until after her first trimester...very understandable. So, only her drs, hubby, and I know...I feel so extremely honored...being the wonderful friend she is, she asked me how I was doing with the news, hoping she didn't depress me. Oh, of course not...I am so so very happy for her...I think she is going to be one of the best moms I know. I know what heartache she has gone through, just wanting a baby so much...I could not be any happier. I tried to tell her this, of course, I don't think she believed me. I seriously have had to deal with this so much this year, it isn't as painful as it used to be. Plus, like I said, I have been praying for her so much, I never gave myself a thought during the conversation...she said, well, if I end up having just one, maybe that will encourage S to let you try chlomid. Haha...I told her, no way, we are shooting for 6 here. (Her test for the hcg shot had shown 2 perfect eggs, 1 other that looked okay). She told me that her eggs could actually split into 3's!!! I said, well, than I'm praying for 9!!! Anyway...I had to share somewhere, just don't tell anyone else! And, remember, pray your little hearts out...I have never known someone more deserving...I promise.

so, we went to the inlaws this weekend...it was interesting. Supposedly, my bil and sil were NOT talking to my mil. Well, hubby and I volunteered to babysit so they could have some "alone" time before sil goes back to work. So, we get up there, call them and they don't want to go out...they would rather spend the time with us. Well, they did not get a "formal" invite to dinner so hubby acted as middle man to arrange it all. They come over, we all have dinner, everything seems hunky-dorey. I notice that evening, sil seems inattentive when it comes to L. I didn't want to pass judgement so I thought maybe it was just the crap with my mil. who knows? Saturday we get up and get ready to go out on the boat. Sil says she will catch up with us later. We go out. Why do we always have to bring both boats??? It makes for a very awkward time. Do we ride with dad or brother? So, hubby and I ride with my bil and send B with mil and fil. Mind you, I am still not feeling quite right...hubby tells everyone I have been having issues with my stomach. Umm...great! So now, everyone looks at me like I'm about to crap my pants...how halarious... We stay out for quite some time...sil calls, still not on her way. By the time she got there, everyone else is ready to go but we stay out for a while longer. I start feeling awful so sil, mil, L, and I pack up while the guys get the boats in. We head out to the pizza place to order pizza. L starts screaming at the top of her lungs...not a whimper, full-fledge screaming. Sil just ignores it. She goes in to order the pizza and L is SHRIEKING...I mean, the baby is 9weeks old but I think she is about to pass out from how hard she is crying. Sil gets back in the car and continues to ignore. So, we get dropped off at inlaws and we will wait for hubby and fil to pick us back up to go over to bil and sil...I rest (fall asleep). We go over there. Eat pizza. Get going. The dog is annoying, barking at everyone which makes L cry...sil still ignoring her. On the way home, mil goes off about how she thinks L's problem is the breast milk because sil has not stopped to think about the way her eating habits affect L. True but I don't know if this is it. Regardless, it showed both hubby and I a little insight into where mil is coming from. Anyway...I remember a friend I have, h, that also knows my sil, saying, I don't know if she will be able to handle a baby...it won't be all about her anymore. I had forgotten that comment until this weekend as I am watching her...I'm still trying not to pass judgement but she was not like any new mother I have ever seen...and I've seen a lot! Usually, when your newborn cries your top priority is to figure out what is wrong and try to get the baby to stop crying...she could not have cared less. And, as I was watching her this weekend, I thought, h was right...she can't handle her show being cancelled. Sad... But, all in all, we had a great time which surprised us both. I had nightmares about babies both nights we were there...which was sad. It was a bittersweet feeling spending so much time with L. I loved holding her and watching her but it was tough because it brought my desire to have a baby right to the surface... oh yeah...bil asked if they could come the WHOLE week with us to FL next year...umm, we offered two nights! S, in your Cinderella story, you'd get to Kiss the Prince You don't need the pouffy dress, the fancy hair, or the 3-inch glass heels. It is SO hard to believe that a week ago we were on vacation...we were shopping in Nassau to be exact. So, here is a mini run-down of our vacation: Saturday: Drop B off at my parents, drive to Elmhurst for Portillo's (YUM!), stop at Kohl's so hubby can buy a watch (his broke Friday night), somehow found ourselves to the Park-n-Jet, fly from Chicago to Miami. Arrive around 8pm (I think) and wait for hotel shuttle to take us to the hotel. Get to the room, relax, go to hotel restaurant for dinner and saw the fireworks from the restaurant. Sunday: Wake up, go downstairs to find some info on what to do in Miami. Concierge hooks us up with a tour guide. Rush back upstairs to get breakfast and get ready. Meet Oscar for our 3 1/2 hour tour. Oscar, who is Cuban, takes us to Coral Gables, South Beach, and several other places...very nice guy...very cute accent...we got to see Julio Iglesias, Rosie O'Donnell, and Gloria Estefan's houses. Hubby bought cigars from a Cuban guy...very cool tour... Sunday night we are hooked up with a FREE limo ride down to South Beach to go to dinner at a fancy Italian restaurant. First time hubby or I remember riding in a limo...fun! After a nice dinner, we walk down to South Beach but it starts raining so we go back and take the limo back to the hotel. Monday: Cruise day! We get up, get breakfast, get ready and go meet the shuttle to take us to the cruise. Getting on the boat did not take as long as we anticipated. We scoped out the boat a bit and had lunch. We go to a mini-seminar about shopping in Nassau and get some free stuff (jewelry, mug, perfume)...go to the casino and get lessons on blackjack and some poker game but I don't remember which one. Have dinner...meet a VERY nice couple from Pennsylvania, not too impressed with the other couples (one couple can't stop complaining about their food). Later on we stop in the casino where I lose $10 in the matter of minutes and I walk away. Stopped to watch the blackjack table and see a guy lose $500 in less time than I lost the $10...all of a sudden, I don't feel so bad. Saw the show... Tuesday: Nassau! We get up and get out shopping. Promised hubby it would be 2hours, it was 3 1/2. Still not bad. Got a bunch of free stuff and some souvenir stuff. Afterwards, we go back to the boat for lunch and a quick rest. Then we head back out to catch a taxi to take us to Paradise Island. We go up to see the Atlantis and walk around for a couple hours...we aren't allowed to go outside to the cool places which suck but serves us right for being too cheap for the tour! We go to their casino where I won $13.25 in the first push of the button (nickle slots)...I feel redeemed from the night before. Take a water taxi back to Nassau and stop by Senor Frog's...two children ask us to pay them $1 for a song. Stop at the straw market...very hot...very pushy people. Go back to the boat. Attend an art auction, get free art. Formal night, we have a bottle of champagne and I feel drunk...haha! Go to the captain's welcome for more champagne...is gross but free! Listen to the band. Wednesday: CocoCay! Get up, have breakfast, take the boat over to the island. Walk around the island and go get snorkeling gear and lesson. Begin snorkeling. See the shipwreck and airplane crash. Lose my conch shell bracelet...find it...lose it again. Get bit by a fish. Go have lunch and go to Aqua park. Realize the park is really for young kids and teens...decide we are too old and fat to get on a giant inflated see-saw and giant inflated "rock" climb (couldn't get our fat butts up and out of the water!) Decide to stop wasting time and go back to snorkeling...go to the last lifeguard station and then head to the deep sea. On the way out, people are coming in saying there has been a shark siting but we see lots of people still out and figure it is a rumor. We see a lot of stingrays, beautiful colored fish, and, yes, a shark! Small one though...I had the camera so I had to try to swim closer to get a picture, don't know if it will turn out or not. After we come in, we are told it is very possible large sharks were in the deep sea section as it is MATING season and they come into more shallow water to mate...beautiful! Go back to boat...see a show. Play the "scavenger" hunt game. Thursday: Key West! We have to wait for everyone to be cleared by customs...get pissed at same idiots whose names are being called. Get cleared. Get breakfast, head out. Call B, he tells me that he is being made to work on his vacation and asks if I have ever heard of working on a vacation...very hostile. Ask if he is having a good time and he says no because he has to work on his vacation...duh, mom! We walk around aimlessly...find the aloe store to get aloe for our sunburn. Find LOTs of beautiful jewelry but nothing quite my price. Keep walking around. Stop for a piece of Key Lime pie. Eat lunch at Hogs Breath. Walk some more...and some more...find a blue topaz I break down and buy. Start heading back to the boat, pass a market to shop at. BOUGHT some shells and a stingray doll for B...stop in one more jewelry store before getting back on the boat...bought a gorgeous mystic topaz in white gold. I feel guilty but hubby assures me I just get it. (He has bought quite a few expensive things for himself by this point so I'm sure my getting the ring makes HIM feel less guilt). Go back to the boat and swim. Take a nap and go to dinner. Pack and fall asleep. Friday: Get up and ready immediately, we have to be off the boat quite early. Get to the hotel around 9 or 10am. I order breakfast and we both take a nap. Get up, watch tv, watch Jersey Girl, take a nap. Get up, go down to gift shop for pop, take another nap and watch tv. Get up, go to hotel restaurant for dinner, go back and lay down. Saturday: Get up EARLY to take shuttle to airport. Plane loaded and then find out valve is broken...delayed 45 minutes. Get to Chicago, get luggage, meet shuttle to go get car...head back to Michigan...stop at parents to give souvenirs and get Brennan...GO HOME!!! Okay...so this is the short version and there are so many memories in my head. If I figure out the picture stuff I will post some once they are returned. It was definitely the best vacation I have ever been on...even more special because hubby and I were ALONE for a whole WEEEK! We were nervous about it but it was just like old times, bumming around with my best friend. Made this week more lonely, but that is okay...it gives me something to look forward to when I have more time with him someday! As for salmon...yes, it was my first time! There isn't a good seafood/fish place in Kzoo...and when I lived in Chicago, I would always get shrimp at those places...I like the salmon when it was warm, when it was cold they had it too salty...

Email I sent from the cruise on Wednesday, July 14th: Good morning! We are about to arrive in CocoCay this morning. We will be going snorkeling and to an "Aqua Park" which, basically, sounds like a water amusement park--we are thinking along the lines of Michigan Adventure??? Of course, last night, I had a nightmare about being bitten by a shark and being stuck on coral so we will see how long I last! We have been having a wonderful time. We got to relax in Miami and took a tour around the city. Our guide was Cuban and very friendly and very knowledgeable. It was neat to walk around with him as he showed us all kinds of places that aren't necessarily tourist attractions. One of his friends gave us some Cuban coffee. I actually liked it! It was VERY strong and made your tongue tingle. Hubby was not a big fan. Later that night, a limo picked us up at the hotel to go down to South Beach for dinner. We ate a lovely Italian restaurant and then walked down to South Beach. The first few hours of the cruise we were a little nervous about being bored but it is NOT even possible! There are a million things going on the boat and we are somewhere different everyday. Yesterday, we were at Nassau and took a taxi over to Paradise Island. I dragged hubby to a special seminar on the boat about the shopping in Nassau...you can imagine how thrilled he was! But we got some "insider tips" and had a successful (though I'm sure hubby would say painful) shopping trip. You will have to ask him about the "Straw Market" sometime...Paradise Island was beautiful and we went up to the Atlantis Resort...amazing. Being the seasoned gambler, I sat down at the nickle slots and won the first push! I was so excited! It was the best $13.25 I have ever had!!! And then, the frugal side of me came out and we walked away...lol!!! Last night was our formal night. It was very nice. I tried salmon for the first time! I tried to get hubby to taste escargout with me, but we chickened out After dinner, the captain's reception took place. Well, we are off...we miss you!Love~S (& S) Well...we are back. We got back into Miami on Friday. I wasn't expecting us to get off the ship so early but we were off and back at the hotel by 10am. We basically napped and watched tv ALL day...I could have used another day of that! Saturday we flew back into Chicago and then drove the rest of the way home. It was so wonderful to see B again. There was only one time, while we were watching Jersey Girl in the hotel Friday, that it hit me hard how much I missed him. Other than that, I did a good job of compartmentalizing. We had an amazing time and I will blog more when I have the energy...I am SO thankful, period never showed up! I was so concerned it would happen the second we left. However, this morning I woke up in hideous pain. What I thought was my period but am now beginning to believe was a cyst bursting. My dr's told me it would feel like a period but, potentially, with no blood. Well, it was the MOST hideous cramping I have had. I was so nauseous and it hurt to even go to the bathroom! Trust me when I tell you, I have had painful, wrenching cramps...I used to be knocked out for a couple days...but this, this was terrible! I couldn't cry because it hurt too much. I seriously thought I was going to pass out...hubby wanted to take me to the emergency room but I just wanted to be crawled up with the heating pad. Lo and behold, this afternoon, I am fine. I am exhausted from this morning and still nauseous but not in hideous pain so I'm convinced I'm healed...and oh so grateful it happened today and not a day earlier!

"Working Mother" magazine has an article this month about 2nd time around infertility. I didn't realize until I read the article how common this problem has become. okay...this weekend, hubby and I watched "Bowling for Columbine." If you haven't seen it, watch it. It doesn't matter if you are democrat, republican, or otherwise. It was extremely interesting and shed light on many things...whether you believe them or not. It raised very pointed questions and didn't necessarily provide answers. Thought provoking. Very glad I watched it, a little scary since these nuts showcased had some tie to Michigan, but very good. Now, I don't know if I have mentioned, but I have never voted. Wait, I did vote, the first time I would have been eligible. Not memorable as I didn't know who I was voting for, I voted Republican since that was who my parents voted for. Scary, I know. Anyway, this year, I really feel I need to vote. The problem? I don't know who to vote for. I pretty much steer clear of politics. Why you ask? Because, I feel, all politicians lie. They say what we want to hear and then do whatever they want once voted in. I think Clinton did a lot to disenchant me...regardless, I think the US has some pretty serious issues...and the first place to fix them would be with our leaders. So, basically, since spring, I have tried to find more information. Do I want to vote to re-elect Bush? Do I want to vote to kick him out? See, I don't see it as voting to put Kerry in. As I mentioned, I think they all lie, so why would I WANT Kerry. Right now, he is lying...I can't tell you if he is good until he has served 4 years. So, right now, I need to decide if I think Bush did a good job...please, feel free to comment away. I'm very open minded. People never believe that when someone says that. Don't get me wrong...on actual ISSUES, I have mucho opinions. On actual people...not so much. At the same time, I can't broaden my horizons without being challenged. I realize that my opinion today may not be the same as it is tomorrow. IE, I used to think I should vote based on my moral beliefs (abortion). Then I realized, this is so not a current issue for our government. By voting for someone who is against abortion, I may be voting for someone who is ripping education and food out of inner-city children's reach...and which is more important??? I don't see Roe vs. Wade being overturned anytime soon, so I need to be more concerned with the children that are here and who is watching over them... See? I told you...I have many opinions but enjoy hearing others. Diversity is to be embraced... sharing ideas is the only way to come up with one that might actually work...

So, Friday was B's surgery. We had to check in at 6:30am! We could tell B was a little nervous but he held up like a trooper. The pre-op nurse was so cute...Ruth. She had B help her with the machine to take his blood pressure and pulse readings. She had an adorable accent and I don't think B could understand what she was saying most of the time. They gave him a medication that reminded me of Staydol...I don't know what it was but it took his apprehensions away. It was funny because he was trying to tell us stories and would forget what he was saying. The anesthesiologist came in and explained what he would be doing. He told us B would experience discomfort/pain from the tube put down his throat. The dr came in and we again asked what type of pain B would have...oh, there is no pain associated! I asked her how she was going to remove the adenoids (through the mouth) because B had wanted to know. They came and took him. Hubby and I were only in the waiting room 30-40 minutes before the dr came back out and said she was done. B's adenoids were significantly larger than in the CAT scan from March so the dr is convinced this was the problem and the removal will solve his issues. Again, we asked what pain we could expect...oh, none! The nurse came to get us a few minutes later and showed us to the recovery room. B was sitting in a chair whimpering. I asked the nurse what was wrong (naively believing he would not be in pain). She explained boys' testosterone and the anesthesia don't mix and they wake up upset. Hubby picked B up so I could put him on my lap and rock. The moment he realized we were there he started shrieking...and shrieking...and sobbing...and shrieking. It was awful. I was not prepared for that (did anyone mention this would happen after asking a million times???)! Meanwhile, the nurses are telling me I have to watch the IV flow...the faster he gets the fluid in him, the faster we go home. Finally, after what seemed like a lifetime, they came in to give him a sedative in his IV. Well, the first one did nothing. So a few minutes later, they were back with another one. He stopped shrieking and just cried. He said his throat hurt really bad. So, we started giving him water. He downed it like he was parched and ate a popsicle. A nurse came in and warned us, the more water you give him, the more likely he is to vomit before you get home. I guess the anesthesia throws off the equilibrium and having so much water in the stomach adds to it. So what do we do? She advised us if it keeps him calm, just give it to him. I thanked her for the advance warning...I would MUCH rather know what I potentially face and prepare for it than be caught off guard (ie, not being forewarned how he would potentially be when he woke up!!!). Thankfully, no vomiting...we got home, put him on the sofa bed and turned on cartoons. Seriously, within an hour he was up and moving around. By the end of the morning, he was bouncing off the walls and you would never know the child had surgery. Great, excellent, blessing...yes. BUT hubby and I had been told he was going to be groggy and tired so he would probably sleep all day. So WE were expecting to be able to sleep all day...man! I am so thankful he came through okay...of course, the night before, I had hideous nightmares and got virtually no sleep. And, yes, I really am grateful that he is back to my rambunctious B. B and I went to Kohl's on Sunday...they had a Superman tshirt on sale that hubby has been looking for to match his tattoo...who do we see? Mr X's mom and stepdad...lordy. I got my hair chopped off on Saturday morning and have yet to figure out how to style it so I am praying they did not see me! Does anyone know of any awesome hair straightening products? My haircut has reminded me why I don't do short...my hair is naturally funky wave and without the weight of long hair it goes crazy...ugh. For example, I straightened and flipped this morning. It is already wavy again!!! I know my hair will take a while to re-train to flip but the wave is nasty...any advice is appreciated!
